snippet: A recent study, by the conservative American Enterprise Institute, showed that female White House staff members make on average 88 cents for every dollar a male staff member earns.
abstract: Pres Obama is making a concerted midterm-election-year push to draw attention to inequality in wages for women, but critics of the administration are eager to point out that women in Obama's White House fair only slightly better.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ANNIE LOWREY

lead_paragraph: A recent study, by the conservative American Enterprise Institute, showed that female White House staff members make on average 88 cents for every dollar a male staff member earns.

headline.main: As Obama Spotlights Gender Gap in Wages, His Own Payroll Draws Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: As Obama Spotlights Gender Gap in Wages, His Own Payroll Draws Scrutiny

keywords.value: American Enterprise Institute for Public Policy Research
keywords.name: organizations
